summary: Email correspondence between US prosecutors and Department of Justice officials regarding the drafting and coordination of an MLAT (Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty) request to the United Kingdom for an interview related to the Epstein investigation. The emails discuss scheduling calls and collaboration between the Southern District of New York and DOJ's Office of International Affairs.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Primary correspondent from the Southern District of New York working on the MLAT request and seeking to coordinate with DOJ officials in London.

persons.context: DOJ official based at the US Embassy in London involved in the MLAT request coordination.

persons.name: OIA Director for UK/Europe
persons.role: DOJ Office of International Affairs Director
persons.context: DOJ official from the Office of International Affairs with responsibility for UK/Europe matters, aware of the sensitive underlying case.

keyFacts: US prosecutors were actively working on an MLAT request to the United Kingdom in March 2020 for an interview related to the Epstein investigation.
The correspondence highlights coordination between the Southern District of New York and the DOJ's Office of International Affairs in London.
The underlying matter is described as sensitive, indicating the ongoing nature of the investigation at that time.
The document shows procedural steps in international legal cooperation for witness interviews in the Epstein case.
